channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
Today I coined a new term -- News Products.

A product made out of news.

I keep looking for something better, but in this case needed a descriptive term.
item.source:markdown:
Today I coined a new term -- News Products.
A product made out of news.
I keep looking for something better, but in this case needed a descriptive term.

item.description:
@dweinberger Even better -- use the benefit in the name --

PowerVoting

It gives you more power. It does. It delivers.

@dweinberger But I agree -- when I hear Ranked Choice Voting my eyes glaze over, and I think I must've missed that day in math class.
2014: Civilization is made of interop. https://t.co/f9KayvGiY1

item.description:
If you use Google Drive, how do you backup what's in the cloud on a local computer?

I downloaded and installed the desktop version of Google Drive, and now it's downloading everything right now. That's what I wanted. Wish I had some control over when it did the download. Oh well. :-)
item.source:markdown:
If you use Google Drive, how do you backup what's in the cloud on a local computer?
I downloaded and installed the desktop version of Google Drive, and now it's downloading everything right now. That's what I wanted. Wish I had some control over when it did the download. Oh well. :-)

item.description:
i am generally critical of the substance and format of cable news, but — the opening segment on Joy Reid’s show last night about women and abortion after Kansas was outstanding, deep, emotionally evocative, inspiring.

Dobbs can stir us to act to care for each other, across all supposed division, at some level the US is still unitable if you push us hard enough.
item.source:markdown:
i am generally critical of the substance and format of cable news, but — the opening segment on Joy Reid’s show last night about women and abortion after Kansas was outstanding, deep, emotionally evocative, inspiring.
Dobbs can stir us to act to care for each other, across all supposed division, at some level the US is still unitable if you push us hard enough.

item.description:
Journalism is so full of shit.

They talk about a "Democratic midterm wipeout" as if it isn't something they invented.

It reminds me of all the stupid articles asking if RSS is d**d. Every time I saw one of those I thought man these journos are chickenshit mofos.
item.source:markdown:
Journalism is so full of shit.
They talk about a "Democratic midterm wipeout" as if it isn't something they invented.
It reminds me of all the stupid articles asking if RSS is d**d. Every time I saw one of those I thought man these journos are chickenshit mofos.

item.description: @dakini_3 Kansas is America.
item.source:markdown: @dakini_3 Kansas is America.

item.description: @brettglass it doesn't assume that.
item.source:markdown: @brettglass it doesn't assume that.

item.description: If the Democrats enjoyed politics even a little, we would be experiencing a huge wave of euphoria right now. We'd all be standing up in praise of Kansas, making the next state want to be next for FOMO. We'd be talking about what we can do next to make the US come together.
item.source:markdown: If the Democrats enjoyed politics even a little, we would be experiencing a huge wave of euphoria right now. We'd all be standing up in praise of Kansas, making the next state *want* to be next for FOMO. We'd be talking about what we can do next to make the US come together.

item.description:
@rswilbourn I hope it's more than that.

Can't wait to watch Ted Cruz try to pivot his way out of this. ;-)

Maybe we should have some referenda about gun rights.
